questions.text: 'The Chosen People' opens with Radar playing 'Reveille', but doing it very poorly.  His horrid playing is rudely interrupted by which of the following?
options: An annoyed Hawkeye, who tosses the trumpet in the latrine
questions.explanation:
An egg in his face.

	In some episodes, eggs are treated as a precious commodity, while in others they are used for gags.  Ah the inconsistency of 'M*A*S*H'! Incidentally, the title of this episode is a play on words.  The word 'Choson' is the name of an early Korean kingdom, and also the name for the last Korean Dynasty, aka the Yi Dynasty.

questions.text: The surgeons at the 4077th have the pleasure of a second visit by Captain Sam Pak.  What very familiar actor plays the part of Sam Pak in this episode?
questions.explanation:
Pat Morita.

	Pat Morita showed up in a total of two 'M*A*S*H' episodes as Captain Pak, the first being 'Deal Me Out' in season one.  As fans of 'Happy Days' know, he did a stint on that popular sitcom as Arnold.  Perhaps his most famous role came in the 1984 movie 'The Karate Kid', where he played Mr. Miyagi.

questions.text: Blissfully whiling away his time in his tent, Henry suddenly receives an unexpected animal guest.  What type of animal gently makes its way into Henry's quarters?
questions.explanation:
Cow.

	Henry has no idea how to handle a farm animal, and quickly calls for Radar's assistance.  'Just take it easy, Bossy,' Henry says, 'No one's gonna hurt you, sweetie.'  Henry also amusingly refers to the cow as a canine, saying, 'Their dog's in here,' when he hears Radar coming.

questions.text: It turns out that a local family formerly lived at the location where the 4077th has been established, and that family wants their land back.  As the family sets up shop, one little boy is very aggressive about performing a certain service for Henry.  What is it?
questions.explanation:
Shining Henry's shoes.

	When Radar attempts to 'pay' the boy with a piece of candy, the lad insists, 'Dollar for shine, Joe!'  When neither Henry nor Radar are able to conjure up a a single simoleon, Henry instructs Radar to get the young tyke 'some grub'.

questions.text: If this family moving into the compound is not enough, a young Korean woman named Choon Hi arrives with child in tow.  She immediately insists that a doctor at the 4077th is the father.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Choon Hi's child is a very, very cute little baby named Su Yong (and I mean, very cute).  When she claims that one of the doctors has spoken very nice 'windsong' to her, Henry immediately suspects two specific surgeons at the 4077th, namely 'Pierce and/or McIntyre'.

questions.text: With discussions raging in Henry's office as to who is the father, Choon Yi suddenly sees Radar, and points to the unsuspecting lad as the one who impregnated her.  Does Radar immediately accept responsibility for fathering the child?
questions.explanation:
No.

	Radar is at first rather indignant, but the rest of the 4077th crew is rather suspicious about their young clerk friend.  Tests are required to prove whether or not Radar is the father.

questions.text: In order to prove whether or not Radar is the father of the baby, a blood test is required.  Here we learn that Radar has what blood type?
questions.explanation:
B.

	Radar is a B, and it turns out that Choon Hi is an O.  The baby, Su Yong, is a type A.  Hence, there is no possibility that Radar is the father

questions.text: An officer from the judge advocate general's office has been sent to the 4077th to help sort out this sticky situation.  What is the name of this lieutenant who has been sent to interview all involved?
questions.explanation:
Lt. Harper

	Lt. Michael Harper, played by Dennis Robertson (who you may remember from the TV show 'Combat!', is never really much help in the whole affair.  In fact, he only gets so far as interviewing Choon Hi before we discover that Radar is not the father.

questions.text: Are they ever able to determine who the true father of Choon Hi's child is?
questions.explanation:
No.

	Despite Radar's valiant attempt at the end of the episode to claim responsibility for the child, the doctors and Lt. Harper are not able to help Choon Hi or her son.  Radar claimed to have been the father of the boy because he wanted to feel like a man.  The truth is, he's still a virgin.

questions.text: The Korean family who has returned to their land, aka the 4077th, are being shipped south where new land awaits them.  What does Father Mulcahy hand each family member just before they depart?
questions.explanation:
A Bible.

	Not sure how those family members will be expected to read the Bibles, but it's a good thought from the gentle Father.  Choon Hi, it seems, has been adopted by the family and she will go south with them.  Everybody lives happily ever after, well, everybody except those still involved in the war. Thank you for playing this quiz, I hope you have enjoyed it!
